Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: YouTube, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: YouTube, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 26, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 9, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 14, 2006



DEAL NO.: 393321


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 14, 2006

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired YouTube Inc for $1.54 billion in a stock-for-stock transaction. According to the terms of the agreement, the number of Google Inc shares to be issued in the transaction is based on the 30-day average closing price ending on November 9, 2006. The acquisition is expected to strengthen and complement Google Inc's video business, which will focus on providing a better, more comprehensive experience for users interested in uploading, watching, and sharing videos. YouTube Inc, which will operate independently to preserve its successful brand and community, is a consumer media company that operates a website allowing people to watch and share original videos.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 3,217,560 GOOG shares issued * $481US.03 GOOG close price on 13 Nov 06

Equity Consideration:

$3,217,560

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,650,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,547,743,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Stock

Stock Payment:

$1,547,742,887

Total Invested Capital:

$1,547,743,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,547,743,000

Country:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Hosts user-generated videos which includes network and professional content

FOCUS - 2 of 192 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2011 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: On2 Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: On2 Technologies, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: July 8, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 5, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 19, 2010



DEAL NO.: 520072


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

January 7, 2010

Closing Date:

February 19, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired On2 Technologies Inc and will now pay US$122.4 million in stock and cash for the entire share capital of On2. Under the terms of the amended agreement, On2 Technologies Inc shareholders will now receive 0.001 of a share of Google Inc common stock and US$0.15 in cash per outstanding share. This amendment is up from the announced offer of US$0.60 worth of Google Inc common stock for each outstanding share. The purchase price represents a 98% premium on On2 Technologies Inc's close price August 4, 2009. The deal allows Google Inc to expand their popular video sharing site YouTube. On2 Technologies Inc's board of directors unanimously approved the transaction and recommends the proposal to its shareholders. On February 17, 2010, On2 Technologies Inc stockholders approved the acquisition of Google Inc.

Transaction Notes:

BE = stock(0.001 exchange ratio * US$543.22 GOOG on 2/18/10 * 176,590,000 o/s of ONT on 10/31/09) + cash(US$0.15 p/s of cash * 176,590,000 o/s of ONT on 10/31/09)

$176,590

.995

TARGET: Urchin Software Corp. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Urchin Software Corp.



LAST UPDATE: October 28, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 29, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 29, 2005



DEAL NO.: 332362


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 29, 2005

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc, an Internet search company, acquired the Urchin Software Corporation, a leading provider of software to assist companies analyze the traffic flow of their Web sites, for US$14.7 million in stock. This acquisition will reinforce Google's advertising and publishing products. Urchin Software Corp, founded in 1995, is a leading provider of professional Web analytics and marketing intelligence software solutions.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 66,765 shares issued * GOOG close $219.45 4/28/05

Equity Consideration:

$66,765

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$12,113,000

$14,652,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Stock

Stock Payment:

$12,112,506

Total Invested Capital:

$12,113,000

Base Equity Price:

$12,112,506

TARGET: AdMob, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: AdMob, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 7, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 9, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 27, 2010



DEAL NO.: 527194


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 27, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired AdMob Inc for US$597 million in stock and cash. AdMob Inc is a provider mobile display ad technology. AdMob Inc is a private equity investment of Accel Partners LLC, Draper Fisher Jurvetson, Northgate Capital LLC and Sequoia Capital. The deal allows Google Inc in its efforts to develop more effective tools for creating, serving and analyzing emerging mobile ads formats. The FTC approved the transaction.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 1,200,000 shares issued * $475.47 GOOG close on 26 May 2010.

Equity Consideration:

$1,200,000

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$687,320,000

Closing Offer Price:

$596,564,000

Terms:

Available

Combo

Cash Payment:

$26,000,000

Stock Payment:

$661,320,000

Total Invested Capital:

$687,320,000

Base Equity Price:

$687,320,000

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Closing Date:

Deal Description:

TARGET: Omnisio, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Omnisio, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 8, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 4, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 4, 2008



DEAL NO.: 486309


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 4, 2008

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Omnisio Inc for an undisclosed amount. Omnisio Inc is a four month old company that enables users to annotate videos, combine clips, and synchronize Slideshare presentations to videos. Google Inc plans to add Omnisio Inc's technology to its YouTube site.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Omnisio, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Enables user to annotate videos, combine clips, and synchronize slideshare presentations to videos

DEAL NO.: 490693


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 12, 2008

Deal Description:

Google Inc through its Korean subsidiary Google Korea LLC, acquired Tatter & Co for an undisclosed amount. South Korea based Tatter & Co provides bloggers Text Cube blog-construction tool. This transaction will allow Google Inc to strengthen its service portfolio and user-oriented contents.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 486006


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 10, 2008

Deal Description:

Publicis Groupe SA acquired Performics Inc from DoubleClick Inc, a subsidiary of Google Inc, for an undisclosed amount. Based in Chicago, Illinois, Performics Inc provides online marketing services and technologies for leading multi-channel marketers. The acquisition will allow Publicis Groupe SA to capitalize on the increasingly profitable search spending market.

Copyright 2009 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Begun ZAO 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Rambler Media Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: June 1, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 18, 2008



DEAL NO.: 483165


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

October 23, 2008

Deal Description:

Google Inc cancelled its agreement to acquire Begun ZAO and related subsidiaries from Rambler Media Ltd, which is controlled by Interros Holding Co ZAO, for a total consideration of RUR3.2 billion (US$140 million). The transaction was cancelled because Google Inc failed to obtain regulatory approval. The Federal Antimonopoly Service, Russia's antitrust service, said that the transaction, if completed, would contradict competition regulations. Previous to this agreement Rambler Media Ltd, which owned 50.1% of Begun, has acquired the remaining 49.9% from Bannatyne Ltd. Of the total consideration, RUR1.6 billion (US$69.9 million) was attributable to Bannatyne, Rambler Media said. Begun is a Russian contextual advertising company. Rambler Media has also signed an agreement to use Google's search and contextual advertising services for its site www.rambler.ru.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$139,962,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$139,962,000

Base Equity Price:

$139,961,787

Begun ZAO

Country:

Russia

Exchange:

London Stock Exchange

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides online advertising services

Transaction Type:

TARGET: Yelp, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Yelp, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: December 21, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 18, 2009



DEAL NO.: 531032


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

December 21, 2009

Deal Description:

Google Inc cancelled its rumored talks to acquire Yelp Inc for an undisclosed price. The rumors stated that the purchase price may exceed $500 million. The transaction would stem from the strategy of Google Inc to expand its reach among local businesses, for which Yelp Inc provides online reviews for local businesses. Yelp, which has raised $31 million in venture capital, is estimated to bring in about $30 million in revenue this year.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Yelp, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Hosts an online database of user-generated reviews of local businesses

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 23, 2009

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Teracent Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition is Google's move to sell more visual advertising on the Internet. Teracent is a 3 year-old startup that offers dynamically tailored display advertising to their target segments. Teracent is a portfolio company of KPG Ventures LLC, and New Enterprise Associates LLC.

Transaction Type:

DEAL NO.: 519213


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 27, 2009

Deal Description:

Time Warner Inc acquired Google Inc's 5% stake in AOL LLC for US$283 million. Google Inc had originally purchased the 5% stake in 2006 for US$1 billion. AOL LLC is currently in the process of being spun off from Time Warner Inc. The price paid for the 5% stake implies a valuation of about US$5.7 billion for AOL LLC.

Percent Owned Before:

95.000%

Percent Sought:

5.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$283,000,000

Terms:

$283,000,000

$283,000,000

TARGET: AOL LLC 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Time Warner, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 15, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 20, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 30, 2006



DEAL NO.: 359176


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 30, 2006

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired a minority 5% stake in America Online Inc, a subsidiary of Time Warner Inc, for US$1 billion in cash. This five-year deal will allow America Online Inc to take advantage of the growing Internet advertising market and strengthen its relationship with Google Inc. In addition, Google Inc will stay as the search engine for America Online Inc. Under the agreement, Google Inc will give America Online Inc free online advertising ads on the search engine worth millions of dollars. America Online Inc will get about 20% of the proceeds from ad sales and Google Inc will receive 80%. America Online Inc is a national Internet service and online content provider.

Percent Sought:

5.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,000,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,000,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,000,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$1,000,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,000,000,000

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 5, 2010

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired DocVerse Inc for an undisclosed amount. DocVerse Inc is a provider of online document editing services. The deal allows Google Inc to further its effort to lure users to its web based productivity software known as Google Docs, which competes with Microsoft's dominant Office software package.

DEAL NO.: 541863


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 12, 2010

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Plink Search Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will strengthen the Google visual search engine tool, Google Goggles. Following the acquisition, Plink founders, Mark Cummins and James Philbin, will be working on Google's visual search engine. Plink Search Ltd is a virtual search company based in the United Kingdom. The company was founded in 2009.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 557082


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 27, 2010

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Ångströ Inc from CommerceNet for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition allows Google Inc to improve its social networking offerings. After the acquisition, Rohit Khare, founder of Ångströ Inc will transfer to Google Inc. Based in Palo Alto, California, USA, Ångströ Inc provides real time notification solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Ångströ, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

LAST UPDATE: December 2, 2010

EFFECTIVE DATE: August 5, 2010



DEAL NO.: 554942


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 5, 2010

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Instantiations Inc for an undisclosed amount. Google Inc acquired the development tools for the Java and Ajax programming languages of Instantiations Inc to include them in Google's Web Toolkit. Instantiations Inc will continue to operate and its founder, Eric Clayberg, will join Google to serve as a board member to the new Instantiations Inc. Based in Portland, Oregon, Instantiations Inc provides software quality and productivity solutions. Instantiations Inc has reported revenue of US$4.4 million last year and currently employs 30.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 20, 2010

Deal Description:

Google Inc has completed the acquisition of Riya Inc for approximately US$100 million. The acquisition is part of Google's focus on enhancing visual search capabilities. Based in San Mateo, California, Riya Inc operates the visual search engine Like.com, which had raised around $54 million from Bay Partners, BlueRun Ventures, Crosslink Capital, First Round Capital, Leapfrog Ventures and Menlo Ventures.

DEAL NO.: 523280


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 16, 2009

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired ReCAPTCHA Inc for an undisclosed amount. ReCAPTCHA Inc is a developer of online puzzles that serve the dual protecting web sites and digitizing printed text. ReCAPTCHA Inc is a spin off of Carnegie Mellon University and was started by assistant professor of computer science Luis von Ahn.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 520065


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 5, 2009

Deal Description:

WideOrbit Inc acquired the radio advertising business of Google Inc for an undisclosed amount. WideOrbit Inc is a privately help San Francisco company that makes software for the broadcast TV and radio industry. WideOrbit Inc will inherit 3,600 customers from Google Inc.

Percent Sought:

TARGET: Green Parrot Pictures

LAST UPDATE: March 16, 2011

EFFECTIVE DATE: March 15, 2011



DEAL NO.: 579183


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 15, 2011

Deal Description:

YouTube LLC, a unit of Google Inc, acquired Green Parrot Pictures for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances the video quality of the uploads to Youtube, such as sharpness and camera shake in amateur footage. Founded in 2004 by Anil Kokaram, Green Parrot Pictures is based in Dublin, Ireland, and provides digital video services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Next New Networks, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. / YouTube LLC 
SELLER: Next New Networks, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 29, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 7, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 7, 2011



DEAL NO.: 569650


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

December 15, 2010

Closing Date:

March 7, 2011

Deal Description:

YouTube LLC, a subsidiary of Google Inc acquired Next New Networks Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction is in line with YouTube LLC's strategy of strengthening its position in the Internet industry. Based in New York, Next New Networks Inc operates as an online media company. Google Inc will pay less than US$50 million for the acquisition of Next New Networks, according to two people briefed on the terms of the deal. Originally, On December 15, 2010 YouTube LLC, a subsidiary of Google Inc is in talks to acquire Next New Networks Inc.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: April 13, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 1, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 13, 2011



DEAL NO.: 542740


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 13, 2011

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired ITA Software Inc for US$700 million in cash. Previously, ITA Software Inc had reportedly been seeking US$1 billion. The transaction helps Google Inc compete with travel search features offered by Microsoft Corp. ITA Software Inc is an airline IT and service provider. ITA's investors include Battery Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, PAR Investment Partners, Sequoia Capital and Spectrum Equity Investors.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,000,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$700,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$700,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$700,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$700,000,000

DEAL NO.: 588587


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 3, 2011

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Postrank Inc for an undisclosed amount. As a result of the deal, all employees of Postrank Inc transferred to Google Inc's headquarters. The acquisition enables Google Inc to apply a new and more efficient system of analyzing data. Based in Waterloo, Canada, Postrank Inc provides online news and other information services and was established in 2007.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Widevine Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: September 29, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 3, 2010



DEAL NO.: 567686


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc agreed to acquire Widevine Technologies Inc for US$158 million in cash. The acquisition is in line with Google's strategy of providing better video streaming services. Widevine, as well, believes that by joining Google, they will be able to meet the needs of a larger consumer base. Widevine provides content security software and online video optimization services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$158,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$158,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$158,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$158,000,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 24, 2003

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired the Sprinks Online Ad Service of Primedia Inc for an undisclosed amount of cash and stock. The Sprinks Online Ad Service provides content-based online advertising services. The company operates a pay-per-click advertising network. Google operates an Internet search engine and PRIMEDIA Inc publishes and distributes books and magazines and provides content delivery through the Internet.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Method of Payment:

Combo

$-1,000,000

$-1,000,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 20, 2001

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired the assets of Outride Inc for an undisclosed amount of stock. Included in this transaction are the intellectual property, patent rights, source code, trademarks, and associated domain names. This acquisition improves upon the technology services of Google Inc to develop online information retrieval services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Method of Payment:

Stock

Stock Payment:

$-1,000,000

DEAL NO.: 317811


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 27, 2004

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Keyhole Corp for an undisclosed amount. Keyhole is a Mountain View, California-based digital mapping company. The acquisition is expected to provide Google with a new search tool as well as to provide Keyhole with expanded resources and operational scales. In conjunction with the transaction, Google announced an immediately effective price reduction for Keyhole 2 LT from US$69.95 to US$29.95.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Baidu.com, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Baidu.com, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 28, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 15, 2004 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 15, 2004



DEAL NO.: 302946


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 15, 2004

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc, a US-based Internet search company, acquired a minority stake in Baidu.com Inc, a Chinese-language Internet search engine, for RMB29.3 million (US$3.5 million) in cash. Baidu.com is the world's largest Chinese search engine based in Beijing, China. Its services range from algorithmic search, pay-for-performance, enterprise search, news, MP3 and image search. The acquisition represented Google's move outside the US to capture additional market shares internationally.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$3,538,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$3,537,956

Total Invested Capital:

$3,538,000

Base Equity Price:

$3,537,956

TARGET: Applied Semantics, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Applied Semantics, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 28, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 23, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 23, 2003



DEAL NO.: 195256


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 23, 2003

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Applied Semantics Inc for US$40.5 million in cash and US$60.9 million in stock. The acquisition would allow Google to strengthen its content-targeted advertising offerings, allowing the delivery of highly relevant and targeted advertisements. In addition, Google said the acquisition would also expand its engineering presence and recruiting efforts in Southern California. The Santa Monica office of Applied Semantics will become the product development center of Google in Southern California.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$102,400,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Combo

Cash Payment:

$41,500,000

Stock Payment:

$60,900,000

Total Invested Capital:

$102,400,000

Base Equity Price:

$102,400,000

Acquisition of Private Company

TARGET: Admeld, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: December 4, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 13, 2011



DEAL NO.: 589179


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

June 9, 2011

Deal Description:

Google Inc signed an agreement to acquire Admeld Inc for an estimated US$400 million. Admeld Inc operates as an online advertising technology company, with the acquisition part of Google Inc's strategy to bolster its business in the market for graphical display ads. Admeld Inc raised $30 million in funding from investors including the Foundry Group, Spark Capital, Norwest Venture Partners and Time Warner Investments. On June 9, 2011, Google was rumored to have acquired Admeld Inc for US$400 million. On December 2, 2011, the US Justice Department cleared the transaction.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$400,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$400,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$400,000,000

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 11, 2011

Deal Description:

YouTube LLC, a subsidiary of Google Inc, acquired RightsFlow Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would let YouTube to efficiently license music. RightsFlow Inc, located in New York, provides mechanical licensing, accounting and royalty payment services of online music.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 13, 2011

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Clever Sense Inc, formerly known as Cellixis Inc, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Google Inc's mobile software applications business. As part of the transaction, all of the employees of Clever Sense Inc would join Google Inc's local services division. Clever Sense Inc is based in Mountain View, California, and develops software applications for mobile devices.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: DailyDeal GmbH 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Rebate Networks GmbH



LAST UPDATE: March 16, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 19, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 19, 2011



DEAL NO.: 600160


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 19, 2011

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired DailyDeal GmbH from founders, Fabian and Ferry Heilemann, Rebate Networks and Insight Ventures Partners for EUR83.7 million (US$114 million) in cash. The transaction also includes the acquisition of the Austrian and Swiss subsidiaries of DailyDeal GmbH. The transaction expands Google's business portfolio in the e-marketing industry. Founded by Fabian and Ferry Heilemann in December 2009 in Berlin, Germany, DailyDeal GmbH operates a web platform for marketing discounted products. The company has 22 employees and in the second quarter of 2011 had revenues amounting to EUR22.8 million (US$31.4 million).

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$113,941,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$113,940,794

Total Invested Capital:

$113,941,000

Base Equity Price:

$113,940,794

LAST UPDATE: June 5, 2012

EFFECTIVE DATE: June 3, 2012



DEAL NO.: 722654


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 3, 2012

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired KikScore LLC for an undisclosed amount. As a result of the acquisition, Google Inc now owns all services, platforms and technologies of KikScore LLC without absorbing any of their employees. Google Inc plans to fully integrate KikScore LLC into its Google Trusted Store, shutting down all operations of KikScore LLC by June 28, 2012. KikScore LLC is based in Denver, Colorado, United States, and provides e-commerce business reports and ratings.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 727732


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 20, 2012

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Sparrow SAS, a portfolio investment company of Kima Ventures SAS for an undisclosed amount. Based in Paris, France, Sparrow SAS develops email clients for both desktop and mobile devices. The Sparrow SAS's team will help develop new projects for Google Inc's Gmail application.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

EFFECTIVE DATE: September 7, 2012



DEAL NO.: 732299


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 7, 2012

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Rotarua Ltd, operating as VirusTotal, for an undisclosed amount. Upon completion, Rotarua Ltd still maintains its independent operations. The deal allows Rotarua Ltd to further improve and widen its operations. Furthermore, the acquisition allows Google Inc to strengthen its security services. Operating since 2004, Rotarua Ltd is located in Campanillas, Spain and operates an online malware and virus scanner.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 4, 2012

Deal Description:

Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc, a subsidiary of Google Inc acquired Viewdle Inc, for a reported amount between US$30 million to US$45 million. The transaction enables Google Inc to incorporate face recognition features in its applications. Viewdle Inc is located in Palo Alto, California, United States and provides facial recognition technology services.

DEAL NO.: 729860


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Google Inc signed a definitive agreement to acquire the business and assets of Frommers Travel Guide Operations from John Wiley & Sons Inc for about US$23 million. The acquisition would strengthen product portfolio of Google Inc. The transaction includes Frommer's travel guide operations and other travel related businesses of John Wiley & Sons Inc. Frommer's travel guide operations publishes travel guides.

100.000%

TARGET: Google, Inc. /Sketchup 3d Modeling Platform/ 
BUYER: Trimble Navigation Ltd. 
SELLER: Google, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 8, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 26, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 1, 2012



DEAL NO.: 720391


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 1, 2012

Deal Description:

Trimble Navigation Ltd entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Google Inc's Sketchup 3D Modeling operations for an undisclosed amount. The addition of the Sketchup 3D modeling operations would allow Trimble Navigation Ltd to develop new applications. Following the transaction, SketchUp's team would be retained. Based in the United States, the SketchUp 3D modeling operations provides software services. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions including the expiration of the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act and is expected to close in the second quarter of 2012.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB



LAST UPDATE: January 28, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 18, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 28, 2010



DEAL NO.: 545784


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 28, 2010

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Acquisition Holdings Inc, a subsidiary of Google Inc, launched a tender offer to acquire Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB for SEK360.8 million (US$46.7 million) in cash. The consideration was satisfied with a cash payment of SEK16 (US$2.1) for every Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB shares. The acquisition complements and enhances the product offering of both Google and GIPS in the development of web platform industry. Subject to a minimum 90% stake of GIPS, Google plans to remove the company from the Oslo Stock Exchange listing upon closing of the deal. The offer document will be available on May 20, 2010 and the offer period will expire on June 4, 2010. In addition, Kistefos Venture Capital AS, and its subsidiary, Kistefos Venture Capital II DA, agreed to tender their shares, equivalent to about 50% stake in GIPS, to Google. Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB develops embedded voice processing technologies for communications and has branches in Stockholm, Hongkong, Boston and San Francisco, USA. On June 7, 2010, Google, Inc extended the offer period to June 11, 2010. With a 75.5% majority stake in Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB, Google Inc again extended the offer period until June 18, 2010 since it was not able to acquire the minimum 90% stake stipulation. The company considered option of removing such condition if it is unable still to achieve 90% stake of Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB. As of June 28, 2010, Google Inc tendered a 90.2% majority stake in Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB, representing 29,210,453 shares, giving the company 99% total ownership in the target. The settlement of the said offer is expected to take place on or about July 1, 2010. The transaction closed on July 28, 2010, and Global IP Solutions was officially delisted on August 26, 2011.

Transaction Notes:

BE = SEK16.000595 cash per share * 22,547,360 GIPS shares o/s.

Premium Offered:

.339

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$2.072736

Original Offer Price:

$46,735,000

Closing Offer Price:

$49,498,000

Price/Earnings:

-7.794

Multiple of Book Value:

13.893

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$46,734,731

Total Invested Capital:

$46,735,000

Base Equity Price:

$46,734,731


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Global IP Solutions (GIPS) Holding AB

Country:

Sweden

Exchange:

Other

Industry:

Telecommunications; Communications

Description:

Develops embedded voice processing technologies for communications

TARGET: Channel Intelligence, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Channel Intelligence, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 13, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 6, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 20, 2013



DEAL NO.: 746847


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 20, 2013

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Channel Intelligence Inc, a portfolio company of Aweida Venture Partners, New South Ventures LLC and ICG Group Inc for US$125 million in cash. The transaction is in line up with the growth strategy of Google Inc and expands its portfolio of online services. Channel Intelligence Inc is located in Celebration, Florida, United States and provides online marketing and management services. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions and was originally expected to close in the first quarter of 2013.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$125,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$125,000,000

$125,000,000

$125,000,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 23, 2011

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Pittsburgh Pattern Recognition for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will enhance Google's other services like YouTube and Google+. Pattern Recognition is based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and develops reliable face recognition software for images and video.

TARGET: DNNresearch, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: April 5, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 12, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 12, 2013



DEAL NO.: 750128


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 12, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired DNNresearch Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction is in line with the growth strategy of Google Inc and expands its portfolio of online services. Following the transaction, Geoffrey Hinton, founder, and other students of Ilya Sutskever and Alex Krizhevsky of DNNresearch Inc would join Google Inc. Founded in 2012, DNNresearch Inc is located in Toronto, Canada and designs and develops artificial intelligence networks.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: April 17, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 10, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 16, 2013



DEAL NO.: 741114


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 16, 2013

Deal Description:

Flextronics International Ltd acquired all the assets of the Tianjin manufacturing operations of Google Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would enable the bidder to enhance its supply chain. Also, the deal was subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals. The transaction was originally expected to be completed by the first half of 2013. The target is located in China, and manufactures mobile electronics.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

FOCUS - 103 of 192 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2013 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Motorola Mobility Holdings, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Motorola Mobility Holdings, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 30, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 15, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 22, 2012



DEAL NO.: 596626


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 22, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc for US$12.1 billion in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Google Inc paid US$40 per share, representing a 63.5% premium to the closing stock price of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc on August 12, 2011. The transaction would strengthen the competition in the mobile computing market. The acquisition was unanimously approved by the Board of Directors of both companies. Based in Libertyville, Illinois, Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc manufactures wireless devices. The transaction was subject to regulatory and shareholder approvals and was expected to close by the end of 2011 or early 2012. On November 17, 2011, Motorola announced that its shareholders approved the proposed acquisition of the company by Google Inc. On November 28, 2011, Google Inc requested regulatory approval from the European Commission. On December 13, 2011, the European Union placed the transaction on hold, pending further investigation. On January 20, 2012, the European Commission settled on February 13, 2012 as the deadline for pronouncing the planned acquisition between Google Inc and Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc. On January 23, 2012, Consumer Watchdog, a US-based consumer advocacy group asked the EU's antitrust regulators to block the pending deal of Google and Motorola Mobility. On February 10, 2012, American analysts announced that they expect the transaction to receive approval from the US Justice Department between February 13, 2012 and February 17, 2012, while the European Commission was set to hand down its decision on February 13, 2012. On February 13, 2012, Google Inc announced that the European Commission approved its proposed acquisition of Motorola Mobility. Also on the same date, the United States Justice Department approved the transaction. On March 8, 2012, the deal was approved by the antitrust watchdog of South Korea. The transaction was expected to close by the first end of the first half. On May 19, 2012, Google Inc announced that the Chinese antitrust authorities cleared the acquisition.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$40 cash per share * 303,676,580 MMI o/s as of March 31, 2012.

Premium Offered:

.858

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$40.000000

Closing Offer Price:

$12,147,063,000

Price/Earnings:

-132.033

Multiple of Book Value:

3.490

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$12,147,063,200

$12,147,063,000

Base Equity Price:

$12,147,063,200

Seller Breakup Fee:

$375,000,000

Buyer Breakup Fee:

$2,500,000,000

Google Inc acquired Wavii Inc for US$30 million in cash. The acquisition is in line with the growth strategy of Google Inc. Following the transaction, employees of Wavii Inc would join Google Inc. Wavii Inc is located in Seattle, Washington, United States and provides on line information services.

TARGET: LendingClub Corp. 
BUYER: Foundation Capital / Google, Inc. 
SELLER: LendingClub Corp.



LAST UPDATE: May 30, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 2, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 2, 2013



DEAL NO.: 754095


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

May 2, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc along with Foundation Capital, acquired a 7% minority stake in LendingClub Corp from its existing shareholders for US$125 million. The transaction would enhance service offerings of LendingClub Corp to its customers. As part of the transaction, David Lawee, vice president for corporate development of Google Inc would become one of the board members in LendingClub Corp. Founded in 2007, LendingClub Corp is located in San Francisco, California, United States and operates as a online marketplace that facilitates loans to qualified borrowers and investments.

Percent Sought:

7.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$125,000,000

Price/Earnings:

-256.863

Multiple of Book Value:

-35.143

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$179,972,000

Base Equity Price:

$125,000,000

TARGET: Motorola Mobility Holdings, Inc. /Home Business Unit/ 
BUYER: Pace PLC 
SELLER: Google, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 8, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 10, 2012



DEAL NO.: 742297


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

April 17, 2013

Deal Description:

Pace Plc cancelled its proposed agreement to acquire the business and assets of the home business unit of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc, ultimately owned by Google Inc, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would position Pace Plc as a global leader in PayTV hardware. The home business unit produces set-top boxes, cable modems and end-to-end video solutions. On April 17, 2013, ARRIS Group Inc instead acquired the home business unit.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Waze, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Waze, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 28, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 9, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 11, 2013



DEAL NO.: 754666


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 11, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Waze Inc for a reported ILS4.6 billion (US$1.3 billion). Waze Ltd is located in Raanana, Israel and operates a social mobile application that enables drivers to build and use real time road intelligence maps. It employs 100 people. On May 9, 2013, Facebook Inc was rumored to be in advanced talks to acquire Waze Ltd for a value of between ILS2.8 billion (US$800 million) to ILS3.6 billion (US$1 billion), had signed a term sheet and commenced the due diligence process. On May 25, 2013, reports first surfaced that Google Inc was also looking at the possibility of making an offer for the company. On May 29, 2013, reports had surfaced that Facebook Inc and Waze Ltd were no longer in talks due to problems with the transfer of Waze Ltd's employees to Facebook Inc's US headquarters.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$1,301,209,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$1,301,209,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,301,209,352

Country:

Industry:

Communications

Description:

Operates a social mobile application that enables drivers to build and use real time road intelligence maps

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 30, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired WIMM Labs Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition is in line with Google's strategy to contend with its competitors in the smartphones accessories industry. Following the acquisition, WIMM Labs Inc employees will be working under Google Inc's Android team. Based in the United States, WIMM Labs Inc designs and develops smart watches.

TARGET: Bump Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Bump Technologies, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 1, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 16, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 16, 2013



DEAL NO.: 765229


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 16, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Bump Technologies Inc, a portfolio company of Sequoia Capital, Y Combinator LLC, Felicis Ventures LLC, Sherpalo Ventures LLC SV Angel LLC and Andreessen Horowitz LLC for an undisclosed amount. The transaction was reported to be valued at less than US$60 million. The deal enhances Google Inc's portfolio of services in mobile applications segment. Following the acquisition, David Lieb, founder and co-founder Andy Huibers, along with all the team members of Bump Technologies Inc would join Google Inc. Founded in 2008, Bump Technologies Inc is located in Mountain View, California, United States and offers mobile applications that allow users to transfer data by tapping phones together.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$60,000,000

Terms:

Available

$60,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$60,000,000

TARGET: FlexyCore SAS

LAST UPDATE: October 23, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 22, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 22, 2013



DEAL NO.: 768482


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 22, 2013

Deal Description:

Google France SARL, a unit of Google Inc, acquired FlexyCore SAS for EUR16.9 million (US$23.1 million). Following the transaction, FlexyCore would be absorbed within Google France's Android team in view of optimizing the company's Android device performance. Established in 2008 by Gilbert Cabillic in Rennes, Brittany, France, FlexyCore SAS develops applications for software optimization solutions such as DroidBooster. The company is supported by both Sochrastem SA and Incubateur Emergys.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$23,277,000

Terms:

Available

$23,277,000

DEAL NO.: 752936


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 23, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired iProvo from Veracity Networks LLC for US$1 million. The acquisition further expands the service offering of Google Inc in broadband services industry and also expands its customer base globally. The transaction was subject to approval from Provo City Council and was originally expected to close on April 23, 2013. Found in 2004, iProvo is located in Provo, Utah, United States and provides fiber optic internet services.

FOCUS - 114 of 192 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2013 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Motorola Mobility Holdings, Inc. /Home Business Unit/ 
BUYER: ARRIS Group, Inc. 
SELLER: Google, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: November 22, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 19, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 17, 2013



DEAL NO.: 731279


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 17, 2013

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

ARRIS Group Inc acquired the business and assets of the Motorola Home business unit of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc, ultimately owned by Google Inc for US$2.4 billion in cash and stock. Under the terms of the revised agreement, ARRIS Group paid US$2.2 billion in cash and issued 10.2 million ARRIS shares. The cash portion was funded through debt financing commitments from Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Royal Bank of Canada. The acquisition would expand the patent portfolio of ARRIS Group Inc. The transaction was expected to close by the second quarter of 2013 and was subject to customary closing conditions. The home business unit of Motorola Holdings Inc produces set-top boxes, cable modems and end-to-end video solutions and has generated revenues of US$3.4 billion for the four quarters ended September 30 ,2012. On August 30, 2012, Google Inc was rumored to be interested in the sale of its home business unit of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc. It was said that the home business unit might fetch a consideration of US$2 billion. Google hired Barclays Plc to seek potential bidders according to sources. On December 10, 2012, Pace plc confirmed to be in talks to acquire the unit in a reverse takeover transaction. Furthermore, Arris Group, and Technicolor SA were reported to have made bids for the unit. On December 19, 2012, ARRIS Group Inc and Google Inc signed the definitive agreement for the transaction. On January 14, 2013, ARRIS Group Inc revised its consideration from US$2.05 billion in cash and US$300 million in stock to US$2.2 billion in cash and US$150 million in stock. The amended consideration was in accordance to the agreement entered by ARRIS Group Inc with Comcast Corp, wherein the latter was to acquire approximately 10.6 million shares, equivalent to 7.9% stake, in the former. On February 11, 2013, the US Department of Justice requested for additional information and documentary materials from ARRIS and Google Inc with regards to the acquisition. On April 12, 2013, the US Department of Justice approved the transaction.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$16.72 ARRS closed April 16, 2013 * 10,600,000 ARRS shares issued

Equity Consideration:

$10,600,000

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$2,000,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$2,417,232,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Combo

Cash Payment:

$2,200,000,000

Stock Payment:

$150,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$2,350,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$2,350,000,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Motorola Mobility Holdings, Inc. /Home Business Unit/

Country:

United States

Exchange:

NASDAQ

Industry:

Electrical Equipment

Description:

Produces set-top boxes, cable modems and end-to-end video solutions

Specializes in the design, engineering and supply of broadband services for residential and business customers

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 1, 2011

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired The Dealmap for an undisclosed price. The Dealmap is a 15 month startup that offers discounts to local merchants. The transaction stems from the strategy of Google Inc to make an entrance into the daily deals services offered on the Internet.

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 14, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Boston Dynamics Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction is part of Google's expansion into robotics, having already acquired seven robotics firms. Founded in 1992, Boston Dynamics Inc is located in Waltham, Massachusetts, United States and designs and develops robots.

TARGET: Postini, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Postini, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 27, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 9, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 14, 2007



DEAL NO.: 430007


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 14, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc has acquired Postini Inc for US$625 million in cash. Postini Inc is an on-demand communications security and compliance solutions serving more than 35,000 businesses and 10 million users worldwide. The acquisition enhances Google Inc message security, archiving, encryption, and policy enforcement. The acquisition is expected to be complete by the end of the third quarter 2007. Postini's investors included venture firms August Capital, Bessemer Venture Partners, Mobius Venture Capital, Pacific Fund, Summit Partners and Sun Microsystems.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$625,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$625,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$625,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$625,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$625,000,000

Postini, Inc.

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides compliance, security, availability and visibility solutions for corporate email and instant messaging

TARGET: DoubleClick, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Hellman & Friedman LLC



LAST UPDATE: March 27, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 13, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 11, 2008



DEAL NO.: 418068


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 11, 2008

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired DoubleClick Inc from Hellman & Friedman LLC, JMI Inc, and management for US$3.1 billion in cash. The acquisition allows Google Inc to offer superior tools for targeting, serving, and analyzing online ads of all types, significantly benefiting customers and consumers. In addition, the acquisition strengthens Google Inc's advertising network with expanded access to publisher inventory. DoubleClick Inc is a New York-based provider of marketing technology and services with 17 offices and 15 data centers worldwide.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$3,100,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$3,100,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$3,100,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$3,100,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$3,100,000,000

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Google Inc acquired Wildfire Interactive Inc for a reported amount of approximately US$250 million. The transaction enables Google Inc to make its marketing solutions more competitive. TARGET: Himax Display, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: October 24, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 22, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 31, 2013



DEAL NO.: 761027


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 31, 2013

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired a 6.3% minority stake in Himax Display Inc from Himax Technologies Inc for an undisclosed amount with an option to increase the stake to 14.8% within a year. The transaction would stand in line of Google's plan to commercialize its Google Glass project. Himax Display Inc is headquartered in Tainan City, Taiwan, Republic of China and manufactures liquid-crystal-on-silicon panel displays and screens.

Percent Sought:

6.300%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Himax Display, Inc.

Country:

Taiwan

Exchange:

NASDAQ

Description:

Manufactures Liquid-Crystal-On-Silicon panel displays and screens

Acquisition

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 15, 2014

Deal Description:

The acquisition would combine Google and Impermium talents, that would make the Internet a more secured place. Located in Redwood City, California, United States, Impermium Corp provides software services.

DEAL NO.: 780135


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

February 19, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Capital, a subsidiary of Google Inc acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Renaissance Learning Inc for US$40 million. The transaction shows Google Capital's interest in education. The investment of Google Capital may help provide ideas and new product opportunity for Google Inc itself, which offers educational versions of products like G-mail and Google Docs as well as Chromebook computers. Renaissance Learning Inc is located in Wisconsin Rapids, Wisconsin, United States and provides technology-based school improvement and student assessment programs for k12 schools.

$40,000,000

Terms:

TARGET: Nest Labs, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Nest Labs, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 11, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 13, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 7, 2014



DEAL NO.: 776331


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 7, 2014

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Nest Labs Inc, a portfolio company of Lightspeed Management Co LLC, for US$3.2 billion in cash. The deal enhances the service offerings of Google Inc. Following the acquisition, Nest Labs Inc continues to operate under the leadership of its CEO Tony Fadell who will report to Google Inc's co-founder and CEO Larry Page. Other sellers in the transaction include Shasta Ventures and Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers LP. The deal was subject to regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions. Founded in 2010 by Tony Fadell and Matt Rogers, Nest Labs Inc is located in Palo Alto, California, United States and transforms the household thermostat into a digital assistant that reduces energy consumption. It has approximately 280 employees as of October 2013. On February 5, 2014, the United States Federal Trade Commission cleared the transaction.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$3,200,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$3,200,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$3,200,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$3,200,000,000

Nest Labs, Inc.

Country:

Electronics

Description:

Transforms the household thermostat into a digital assistant that reduces energy consumption

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

May 3, 2014

Deal Description:

Following the transaction, Ryan Regan, founder of Rangespan Ltd along with some employees joins Google Inc. Rangespan Ltd is located in London, London & South East, United Kingdom and develops low risk way for retailers to grow and optimize their product ranges.

TARGET: Appurify, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Appurify, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 30, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 25, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 25, 2014



DEAL NO.: 792365


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 25, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Appurify Inc, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction gives Google Inc a further scale and bring Appurify Inc's expertise to the web and mobile application development process. Appurify Inc will be able to help Google Inc's developers to handle fragmentation to catch bugs and other performance issues on devices and make applications that supports both iOS and Android to run properly. Prior to the acquisition, Appurify Inc have raised a total of US$6.3 million from investors including Google Ventures, Data Collective, Radar Partners, Felicis Ventures, and Foundation Capital. Appurify Inc will remain open on iOS and Android. Founded in 2012, Appurify Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and provides mobile application services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 19, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired mDialog Corp, a portfolio company of Relay Ventures, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Google Inc's portfolio of video advertising technology service offerings. Following the transaction, mDialog Corp's technology would integrate with Google Inc's DoubleClick digital advertising business. Founded by Greg Philpott in 2006, mDialog Corp is located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and provides online video sharing services.

100.000%

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 19, 2014

Following the transaction, Alpental Technologies Inc's team would join Google Inc. Founded by Pete Gelbman and Mike Hart, Alpental Technologies Inc is located in Bothell, Washington, United States and provides cloud management services.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 23, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired drawElements Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would strengthen the service offerings of Google Inc in mobile 3D graphics solutions industry and also expands its customer base globally. Following the transaction, employees of drawElements Ltd would join Google Inc. drawElements Ltd is located in Helsingfors, Uusimaa, Finland and specializes in analyzing and assessing mobile 3D graphics.

TARGET: Directr, Inc.

SELLER: Directr, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 7, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 6, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 6, 2014



DEAL NO.: 796847


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 6, 2014

Deal Description:

YouTube LLC, a subsidiary of Google Inc acquired Directr Inc, a portfolio company of Initialized Capital Management LLC, Boston Seed Capital LLC, NextView Ventures LLC and Advancit Capital LLC, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances YouTube LLC's portfolio of mobile and advertising capabilities. As part of the transaction, all of the employees of Directr Inc would join YouTube LLC's video ads team. Directr Inc is located in Boston, Massachusetts, United States and operates as a mobile application company which provides users to create movies on phones.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

May 6, 2014

Founded in 2005, Adometry Inc is located in Austin, Texas, United States and provides ad verification and cross-channel attribution intelligence, auditing and scoring metrics. Following the acquisition, the 130 employees of Adometry Inc will eventually be joining the Google Analytics Premium team.

DEAL NO.: 800563


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 11, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Input Factory Inc, trading as Polar, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would allow Google Inc to continue to focus on its social networking application Google+. Following the transaction, Luke Wroblewski, founder of Input Factory Inc, along with his team would join Google Inc. Founded by Luke Wroblewski in 2012, Input Factory Inc is located in Los Gatos, California, United States and develops mobile applications for collecting and sharing opinions. Input Factory Inc is a portfolio company of Webb Investment Network LLC, Greylock Management Corp, Morado Venture Management LLC and Battery Ventures.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Not disclosed

TARGET: Skybox Imaging, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Skybox Imaging, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 24, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 10, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 1, 2014



DEAL NO.: 790753


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 1, 2014

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Skybox Imaging Inc for US$478 million in cash. The transaction provides Google Inc with the technology to collect up-to-date satellite images that can be used to incorporate to its Google Maps product. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals in the United States and approvals from the National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration as well as the Federal Communications Commission. Rumors surfaced on April 7, 2014 where Google Inc was reported to be in talks to acquire Skybox Imaging Inc for an undisclosed sum. Skybox Imaging Inc is located in Mountain View, California, United States and develops technology services to interpret satellite data more efficiently. It has approximately 100 employees.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$478,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$478,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$478,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$478,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$478,000,000

TARGET: Dropcam, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. / Nest Labs, Inc. 
SELLER: Dropcam, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 24, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 20, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 17, 2014



DEAL NO.: 791867


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 17, 2014

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Nest Labs Inc, a subsidiary of Google Inc, acquired Dropcam Inc, for US$517 million in cash. The acquisition enhances the product and service offerings of Nest Labs Inc in the Internet-connected video monitoring market. Following completion, Dropcam Inc's services will no longer be shared to the public without a customer's permission. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals. Dropcam Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and manufactures Wi-Fi video camera with cloud-based monitoring and digital video recorder services. Dropcam Inc is a portfolio company of Institutional Venture Partners, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Felicis Ventures, Menlo Ventures and Accel Partners.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$517,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$517,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$517,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$517,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$517,000,000

Name:

Dropcam, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Electronics

Description:

Manufactures Wi-Fi video camera with cloud-based monitoring and digital video recorder services

DEAL NO.: 804942


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 21, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Firebase Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction would enhance Google Inc's web application solutions. Following the acquisition, Firebase Inc's employees would join Google Inc's cloud-computing team. Firebase Inc is a portfolio company of Inspovation Ventures, Y Combinator LLC, Data Collective LLC, Founder Collective (Ventures), Expansion Venture Capital LLC, Flybridge Capital Partners, Union Square Ventures LLC, New Enterprise Associates LLC and New Enterprise Associates LLC. Firebase Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and provides real-time data synchronization service designed to power collaborative applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 805204


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Nest Labs Inc, a subsidiary of Google Inc, agreed to acquire Revolv Inc, formerly known as Mobiplug Networks Inc, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction expands the bidder's market presence into the Boulder area. Revolv Inc is located in Boulder, Colorado, United States and develops and delivers smart phone-controlled home monitoring and control systems. Revolv Inc is a portfolio company of Foundry Group LLC, Bullet Time Ventures LP, SK Ventures, Clarion Direct Investment LLC, Social Leverage LLC and TechStars LLC.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: DeepMind Technologies Ltd. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: DeepMind Technologies Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: December 2, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 26, 2014



DEAL NO.: 777564


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Google Inc agreed to acquire DeepMind Technologies Ltd for a reported value of GBP242.4 million (US$400 million) up to GBP303 million (US$500 million). Founded by Demis Hassabis, Shane Legg, and Mustafa Suleyman in 2012, DeepMind Technologies is located in London, London & South East, United Kingdom and develops software technology based on artificial intelligence. As of October 24, 2014, the Google Inc has joined forces with Oxford University to further investigate on the deal.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$500,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$500,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$500,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$500,000,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

DeepMind Technologies Ltd.

Country:

Great Britain

Industry:

Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops software technology based on artificial intelligence

TARGET: Lynx Design, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Lynx Design, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: December 18, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 10, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 10, 2014



DEAL NO.: 800634


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 10, 2014

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Lynx Design Inc, doing business as Lift Labs, for an undisclosed amount. Following the acquisition, Lift Labs would be part of Google Inc's life sciences division. The acquisition provides the bidder a new technology to combat neurodegenerative diseases. Lynx Design Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and manufactures mechanical spoons.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Lynx Design, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Household Goods

Description:

Manufactures mechanical spoon

TARGET: Launchpad Toys, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Launchpad Toys, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: February 6, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 4, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 4, 2015



DEAL NO.: 816475


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 4, 2015

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Launchpad Toys Inc, a portfolio company of Y Combinator LLC and TEEC Angel Management LLC for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would enhance portfolio service offerings of Google Inc in child friendly storytelling mobile application services industry and also expands its customer base globally. As part of the acquisition, employees of Launchpad Toys Inc would join Google Inc. Launchpad Toys Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and creates and develops digital toys and tools for kids.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Launchpad Toys, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Toys & Recreational Products

Description:

Creates and develops digital toys and tools for kids

TARGET: Nimbus, Inc. /Odysee Business/ 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Nimbus, Inc. /CA/



LAST UPDATE: February 11, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 9, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 9, 2015



DEAL NO.: 816845


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 9, 2015

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired the business and assets of Odysee from Nimbus Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition strengthens the photo applications of Google Inc and also enhances its network sharing services Following the transaction, Odysee's team would join Google Inc. As part of the deal, Odysee would shut down its services from February 23, 2015. Odysee business develops software for mobile applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Nimbus, Inc. /Odysee Business/

Country:

United States

Industry:

Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops software for mobile applications
