TARGET: Red Hot Labs, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Red Hot Labs, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 1, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 24, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 24, 2015



DEAL NO.: 818566


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 24, 2015

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Red Hot Labs Inc, a portfolio company of IT-Farm Corp, Greylock Management Corp, SV Angel LLC and AH Capital Management LLC, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances Google Inc's investment portfolio. The transaction would allow Red Hot Labs Inc to expand its services. Following the acquisition, Red Hot Labs Inc's team would join the mobile ads team at Google Inc. Founded in 2012, Red Hot Labs Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and provides infrastructure for mobile game developers.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Red Hot Labs, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Miscellaneous Services

Description:

Provides infrastructure for mobile game developers

TARGET: Thorgate 
BUYER: Google, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: April 10, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 1, 2015



DEAL NO.: 822606


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Google Inc agreed to acquire Thorgate Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enables Google Inc's to focus on the development of software solutions for self driving cars. Founded in 2011, Thorgate Ltd is located in Tallinn, Estonia and develops software solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 28, 2015

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Pulse.io Inc, a portfolio company of Plug & Play Ventures, Camp One Ventures LLC and Partech Partners SAS for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition allows Google Inc to enhance software offerings. Pulse.io Inc is located in San Mateo, California, United States and monitors software application performance.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Lumedyne Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: June 12, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 2, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 2, 2015



DEAL NO.: 829372


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 2, 2015

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Lumedyne Technologies Inc for US$85 million in cash. The acquisition would be used to strengthen Google Inc's product offerings. Following the transaction, Lumedyne Technologies Inc's employees would be retained in the company. Founded in 2006, Lumedyne Technologies Inc is located in San Diego, California, United States and provides sensor technology services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$85,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$85,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$85,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$85,000,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 18, 2015

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Agawi Inc formerly known as iSwifter Inc, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would be used to strengthen Google Inc's product offerings. Following the transaction, Agawi Inc's employees would be retained. Agawi Inc is located in Campbell, California, United States and operates a cloud-based gaming platform.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 21, 2015

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Pixate Inc, a portfolio company of Y Combinator LLC, Accel Partners LLC, and Appcelerator, for an undisclosed amount. As part of the transaction, all of the employees of Pixate Inc would join Google Inc. Pixate Inc is located in Palo Alto, California, United States and designs and develops native mobile interfaces.

Copyright 2015 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Motorola Mobility Holdings, Inc. 
BUYER: Lenovo Group Ltd. 
SELLER: Google, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 29, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 29, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 30, 2014



DEAL NO.: 777954


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 30, 2014

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt, Notes / Bonds, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Lenovo Group Ltd acquired Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc from Google Inc for approximately US$3.2 billion in cash and stock. Under the agreement, Lenovo Group Ltd would pay US$660 million in cash, US$1.5 billion in debt notes, and would issue 519,107,215 shares at an aggregate value of US$769.8 million. The issued shares represents about 4.7% of the company's outstanding shares. The stock consideration was at first limited to a maximum of 618,301,731 shares and a minimum of 505,883,235 shares. A separate cash compensation of about US$228 million was paid primarily for the cash and working capital held by Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc. The acquisition would allow Lenovo Group to extend its market presence in the Smartphone business as it gain access to 2,000 patents of the target, while the rest of the intellectual property would be transferred to Google Inc prior to completion. Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc is located in Libertyville, Illinois, United States and manufactures wireless devices. It was acquired by Google Inc in May 2012 for US$12.1 billion to gain access to 17,000 patents related to mobile communications. On May 6, 2014, the Conselho Administrativo de Defesa Econômica (CADE) of Brazil approved the deal. On June 27, 2014, the European Commission cleared the transaction. On September 22, 2014, reports indicated that the deal was originally expected to close by the end of 2014. As of August 27, 2015, it was announced that Lenovo Group Ltd would merge into Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc.

Equity Consideration:

$519,107,215

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$2,860,795,000

Closing Offer Price:

$2,929,836,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Combo

Cash Payment:

$660,000,000

Stock Payment:

$700,794,740

Debt Payment:

$1,500,000,000

Other Payments:

$228,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$3,088,795,000

Base Equity Price:

$2,860,794,740

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 8, 2011

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Zagat Survey LLC for US$151 million in cash. The acquisition provides an opportunity for Google Inc to expand its existing business. Following the acquisition, co-founders Nina and Tim Zagat would still remain in the company as co-chairs. Based in the United States, Zagat Survey LLC provides consumer survey-based leisure content.

TARGET: Bebop Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Alphabet, Inc. / Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Bebop Technologies, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: February 4, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 19, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 4, 2016



DEAL NO.: 848904


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 4, 2016

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Google Inc, a wholly owned subsidiary of Alphabet Inc, acquired Bebop Technologies Inc for US$380.2 million in stock. The acquisition will help Google to enhance and expand its product offering. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions. Following the closing of the transaction, Diane Greene, the CEO, member of the board, and a stockholder of Bebop, will become the Senior Vice President of Google. L. John Doerr is expected to be appointed by the board to take the place of Diane Greene in the Audit Committee of Google. Bebop Technologies, Inc is located in Los Altos, California, United States and provides software applications. The transaction is expected to close in 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$380,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$380,241,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Stock

Stock Payment:

$380,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$380,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$380,000,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 5, 2006

Deal Description:

Google Inc, a public US company that provides Internet search engine services and Internet advertising programs, acquired Reqwireless Inc, a private Waterloo, Ontario-based company, for an undisclosed amount. According to an e-mail statement made by Google to the Financial Post, "We acquired Reqwireless because of talented engineers and great technology. We're thrilled to have them here." Google also added, "We are looking for people with experience in making the Web and Web services available on mobile platforms. Our goal in the wireless group is to make the world's information universally accessible and useful at any time and in any place." The transaction also enabled Google to establish and grow in the Waterloo and Kitchener region of Ontario, where there has been massive growth in computer engineer talents, growth in the software development and wireless technology markets, and where one of North America's leading computer science programs in the University of Waterloo is provided. Reqwireless products will no longer be available for sale.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Reqwireless, Inc.

Country:

Canada

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops and provides web browser and e-mail software for wireless devices

DEAL NO.: 367345


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 9, 2006

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Upstartle for an undisclosed amount. Upstartle developed and offers an Internet based word processing program called Writely that allows its users to share documents online so other users in different locations can write and edit them together.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: November 17, 2006

EFFECTIVE DATE: November 16, 2006



DEAL NO.: 399202


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 16, 2006

Deal Description:

Google Inc has acquired an Israeli startup, iRows, a online spreadsheet company, for an undisclosed amount. Though Google denied acquiring iRows, iRows founders have joined Google and will shut down the site on December 31, 2006. The acquisition is expected complement Google's current line of business.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

iRows

Country:

Israel

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides browser-based spreadsheet services

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 15, 2006

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Neven Vision Inc for an undisclosed price. The acquisition stems from part of Google Inc's strategy to expand upon its Internet services. Google Inc could use this software to improve local search and advertising from cell phones.

DEAL NO.: 404620


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 18, 2006

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired the entire share capital of Endoxon AG for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will allow Google Inc to increase its expertise in the area of online mapping and geo-referencing services. The deal does not include the data, cartography and direct marketing operations of Endoxon AG. The latter will continue to operate as Mappuls AG.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Endoxon AG

Country:

Switzerland

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides multimedia, internet and mobile applications services

TARGET: Xunlei Network Technology Ltd. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Xunlei Network Technology Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 4, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 5, 2007



DEAL NO.: 405529


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 5, 2007

Deal Description:

California-based listed Google Inc completed the acquisition of an undisclosed minority stake in Xunlei Network Technology Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Based in Shenzhen, Xunlei provides peer-to-peer file sharing network and download acceleration services. According to the press release, "More than 80 million users have installed its download accelerating software and its websites attract more than 50 million visitors a day." Google believes the transaction would enable the company to accelerate the penetration into the China on line search engine sector.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Xunlei Network Technology Ltd.

Country:

China

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides peer-to-peer file sharing network and download accelerating services

DEAL NO.: 418528


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 17, 2007

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Tonic Systems Inc for an undisclosed amount. Tonic System's team and technology are expected to be a strong fit with Google's existing document and spreadsheet products. San-Francisco-based Tonic Systems Inc provides Java presentation automation products and solutions for document management.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Ubiquisys Ltd. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Ubiquisys Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: July 26, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 21, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 21, 2007



DEAL NO.: 431933


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

July 21, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired an undisclosed stake in cash in Ubiquisys Ltd, a femtocells vendor based in Swindon, UK. Femtocells (indicating an order of size in physics that is smaller than "pico" or "nano") are cellular base stations for individual homes or offices. Ubiquisys Ltd was founded in 2004 and earlier in 2007, introduced the ZoneGate femtocell system. Google, Inc acquired the stake by participating in a funding round worth GBP12.2 million (US$25 million).

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$-1,000,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Ubiquisys Ltd.

TARGET: Tianya.cn

LAST UPDATE: August 21, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 21, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 21, 2007



DEAL NO.: 436154


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 21, 2007

Deal Description:

Google Inc, a public US company that provides Internet search engine services and Internet advertising programs, acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Tianya.cn for an undisclosed amount. Based in Hainan Province with offices located in Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangdong, the target is principally engaged in the operations of a social networking web site and has registered users of more than 20 million. The target and bidder also announced the launch of two web sites powered by Google technology. The acquisition would enhance Google's presence in the emerging China market and strengthen the company's core business.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

July 3, 2007

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired GrandCentral Communications Inc for an undisclosed amount. GrandCentral Communications Inc provides services that let users personalize phone usage with Web-based features like the ability to assign a single phone number that rings various phones at once, records calls and accesses visual voicemail.

TARGET: Jaiku Oy 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: Jaiku Oy



LAST UPDATE: October 11, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 10, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 10, 2007



DEAL NO.: 442700


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 10, 2007

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired Jaiku Oy for an undisclosed price. In a note posted Tuesday on Google's blog, Tony Hsieh, a product manager for the company, said it believed that Jaiku's technology could help develop new ways to use mobile devices. Founded last year in Helsinki, Jaiku specializes in mobile phone software that makes it easier for users to share updates about their whereabouts and thoughts. The concept, known as microblogging, is also being promoted by Twitter, a San Francisco start-up.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Jaiku Oy

Country:

Finland

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Specializes in mobile phone software that makes it easier for users to share updates about their whereabouts and thoughts

DEAL NO.: 425392


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 5, 2007

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired PeakStream Inc for an undisclosed amount. PeakStream Inc offers a commercially available software application platform to help technicians program high performance, multi-core and parallel processing machines. The acquisition is intended to be integrated and be used by Google Inc to optimize its online data network.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Copyright 2007 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: GreenBorder Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Google, Inc. 
SELLER: GreenBorder Technologies, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: December 23, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 29, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 29, 2007



DEAL NO.: 424104


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 29, 2007

Deal Description:

Google Inc acquired GreenBorder Technologies Inc for $7.5 million. GreenBorder Technologies, based in Mountain View, California, offers security software that sets up temporary, virtual sessions each time computer users surf the Web, then discards the resulting data once the user is finished surfing. GreenBorder's "virtualization" technology will be incorporated across a range of Google products to better protect Internet activity and interaction.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$7,500,000

Closing Offer Price:

$7,500,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$7,500,000

Base Equity Price:

$7,500,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

GreenBorder Technologies, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Delivers security software solutions for enterprises
